intro: Hedeoma ciliolata, commonly known as the smoothleaf hedeoma, is a flowering plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Hedeoma ciliolata is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and traditional herbal use.
